body.p: This topic describes all the known issues that you might encounter:

section.title: Cannot use admin commands in OpenStack Identity CLI
section.p: Using the OpenStack CLI, the user cannot perform any administrative action related to the Identity (Keystone) service. For example: project list, tenant list, tenant create.

ul.li: Keystone v2 does not support admin actions on identity service over CAN (Public URL) network.
Kilo-based python-openstackclient does not support the environment variable named OS_INTERFACE to indicate which URL to enforce. Keystone v3 does support this environment variable.

section.p: Use the Keystone v3 endpoint in your stackrc file as below:
section.pre: export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_PASSWORD=r54DQY export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_PROJECT_NAME=admin export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=Default export OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID=default export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_VERSION=3 export OS_REGION_NAME=memphis export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.x.x.x:5000/v3 export OS_CACERT=/home/cghelion/ca.crt export OS_INTERFACE=public
section.p: Also, make sure you are using the Liberty-based python-openstackclient (openstack 1.7.0).

For example, if you are running OpenStack CLIs on an Ubuntu guest:
Update the package repository of the Ubuntu client to point to OpenStack Liberty repository:apt-get install ubuntu-cloud-keyring echo "deb http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu" \ "trusty-updates/kilo main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloudarchive-kilo.list apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade
Install python OpenStack Clientapt-get install python-openstackclient

section.title: KVM Region compute node cannot be unlocked multiple times
section.p: After unlocking a compute node in the KVM Region for the first time, the node keeps rebooting during subsequent locks.

The unlock and the reboot process gets stuck at compute-huge.sh restart and times out after 300 seconds causing compute node to reboot. The process is trying to access http://pxecontroller . Due to a bug, this host name is not pingable as there is no PXE IP on any of the interfaces.
Provide a route from CLM network to PXE such that pxecontroller is reachable from CLM network.

section.title: Baremetal Control plane RDBMS recovery after reboot

body.p: The controller in the baremetal region of the Sacaramento deployment is designed to be a single control plane. If the controller reboots, the MySQL database installed into the controller crashes and the mysql service does not restart.

ol.li:
From the lifecycle manager VM, log in to the baremetal controller after reboot.ssh cghelion@<BM_Controller_IP>
The BM_Controller_IP address can be obtained from the nodes.json file in /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud_name>/ directory on the lifecycle manager.
Switch to the root user:sudo su -
Execute the following command to manually restart the mysql service:/etc/init.d/mysql bootstrap-pxc
Execute the following command to check status of mysql service: service mysql statusThis status should be active.
Log in to MySQL. sudo su -
Execute the following command to log into the MySQL database: mysql

Check that the previous data is intact: Example commands:
ironic node-list should display the nodes registered before reboot
neutron net-list should display the created networks

title.b: Unable to create an instance in the non-KVM region

section.p: When trying to create a virtual machine instance in the non-KVM region, the user receives a No valid host found error. Check that all ESX host machines in the cluster are configured with the ESX compute proxy. If one or more hosts in the cluster is configured with the proxy, disconnect the host(s) from the cluster or install the ESX compute proxy.

section.title: Backup storage size should be at least 120GB
section.p: If you experience the following error, you can edit the region_config file for the KVM region to increase the default storage.

ol.li: Log into the KVM region controller-0.
Edit the ./<cloud name>/clouds/<cloud name>/001/stage/windriver-config/region_config file to update the backup_storage value to 120 or higher.

section.title: Glance/Swift not recovering after failure
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Image Operations (Glance) service is based on OpenStack Glance, which uses embedded OpenStack Swift for back-end storage.

In the event of an embedded Swift node failing, Swift may take longer to report correctly the addition of new files and containers. This delay can be mitigated by replacing the failed node as soon as possible, or by removing the failed node from the ring. See the swift documentation, Swift Administrator's Guide, Handling Server Failure for further details on coping with single node failure.

section.title: Two controllers have failed
section.p: A restore procedure is required when two controllers have failed. HA Services are not guaranteed to be resilient after a second failure. See Backup and Restore Configuration Files and MySQL Clusters.
